verses.verse: Arise, O LORD! O God, (Ps. 17:7; 94:2; Mic. 5:9) lift up Your hand! Do not forget the (Ps. 9:12) humble.
Why do the wicked renounce God? He has said in his heart, “You will not require an account.”

But You have ((Ps. 11:4)) seen, for You observe trouble and grief, To repay it by Your hand. The helpless ((2 Tim. 1:12)) commits himself to You; (Ps. 68:5; Hos. 14:3) You are the helper of the fatherless.
Break the arm of the wicked and the evil man; Seek out his wickedness until You find none.
(Ps. 29:10) The LORD is King forever and ever; The nations have perished out of His land.
LORD, You have heard the desire of the humble; You will prepare their heart; You will cause Your ear to hear,
To do justice to the fatherless and the oppressed, That the man of the earth may oppress no more.
(Faith in the LORD’s Righteousness) To the Chief Musician. A Psalm of David. [1] In (Ps. 56:11) the LORD I put my trust; How can you say to my soul, “Flee as a bird to your mountain”?
